summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/07/10
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tom McLoughlin'], 'Producers': ['Carroll Newman'], 'Starring': ['Valerie Bertinelli', 'Stephen Caffrey', 'Graham Beckel'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
Review Text: This is not a "bad" movie,  It was good enough to watch, but a typical Lifetime movie.  Valerie Bertinelli was about the best I have ever seen her as a very convincing off-balance person.  The movie could have delved a little more into what made her character the way she was, but all and all not a waste of time.  There were a couple of surprises.  I probably would watch it again.
Review Title: Typical Lifetime movie
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/07/10
Average Rating: 3.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Howard Braunstein Films'], 'Producers': ['Ted Bauman', 'Lynne Bespflug', 'Howard Braunstein', 'David Dewar', 'Nancy Grace', 'Darin Oishi', 'Josh Sabarra', 'Dean Sicoli'], 'Studio': ['Lifetime']}
Review Text: I really don't know what to say about this movie.  It wasn't bad but wasn't that good.  I watched it over two nights because I just couldn't get into it.  It is coming off my watchlist because I just don't see any reason to watch it again.  It you are just looking for some background noise or a movie you don't have to concentrate on to follow, you may like this one.
Review Title: A Snoozer
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/07/18
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ross Katz'], 'Producers': ['Brad Krevoy', 'Cathy Wischner-Sola', 'Ross Katz', 'Lori Keith Douglas'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Bacon', 'Tom Aldredge', 'Blanche Baker'], 'Studio': ['HBO']}
Review Text: Very moving story and very well told.  A touchy subject perhaps but handled with grace.  Kevin Bacon is wonderful in his role as the escort.
Review Title: Keep a box of tissues handy
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/08/19
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brian Percival', 'David Evans', 'Philip John', 'Andy Goddard', 'Catherine Morshead', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Brian Kelly', 'Michael Engler', 'Ben Bolt', 'Ashley Pearce'], 'Producers': ['Liz Trubridge'], 'Starring': ['Huge Bonneville', 'Michelle Dockery', 'Maggie Smith'], 'Studio': ['BritBox']}
Review Text: Well done PBS series, about to start its fifth series.  Follows a pre-WWI family of privilege and the changes that come to the family and their staff.  This series is quite addictive and I look forward to a new season every year.  The downside is that the series shows in England about four or five months ahead of the showing here in the States.
Review Title: Addictive
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/10/28
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Vetri'], 'Producers': ['Isabel San Vargas', 'Mitch Rosa', 'Ralph Wikke', 'Hank Leukart', 'Paul Cabana', 'John McLaughlin', 'Heather Murphy', 'Zachary Green', 'Marissa Ramirez'], 'Studio': ['A&E Television Networks']}
Review Text: If you're a gun aficionado or just a casual fan, this show should be interesting to you.  Shooting experts and ordinary people are included on the teams which compete until only one person remains who will win the title of Top Shot and a sizable cash prize.  The weapons include other guns from many eras and other weapons such as bow and arrows and even rocks, so the competition is not limited to just who is the best pistol or rifle shot.  Most of the time, it is hard to believe that an hour has passed when watching this show.  I believe it is currently in season six so this is a good way to catch up.  The only downside I know is sometimes the "host" talks a little too much.
Review Title: so the competition is not limited to just who is the best pistol or rifle shot
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/12/14
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Nigel Stafford-Clark'], 'Producers': ['Nigel Stafford-Clark'], 'Starring': ['Gillian Anderson', 'Denis Lawson', 'Charles Dance']}
Review Text: This was a pretty good series if you enjoy period shows.  At times it moves a little slowly but has enough twists and turns to keep it interesting.  I didn't guess the ending.  I had not read the book so I do not know if it followed the book or not.  I would recommend this series.  I don't believe there was a season two.
Review Title: Good period piece
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/04/23
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ken Burns'], 'Producers': ['Florentine Films', 'WETA'], 'Starring': ['Peter Coyote', 'Paul Giamati', 'Edward Hermann'], 'Studio': ['PBS']}
Review Text: Excellent walk through the history of the two families who brought us two presidents.  Each dynamic in his own way and each of whom overcame medical issues to become two of the greatest presidents in our history.  If you are a history buff at all, you will love this series, but you don't have to be to get hooked.
Review Title: Hooked on history
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/06/23
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeremy Webb', 'Roxann Dawson'], 'Producers': ['Ridley Scott', 'David W. Zucker', 'Lisa Q. Wolfinger', 'David Zabel', 'Clayton Krueger', 'David Rosemont'], 'Starring': ['Mary Elizabeth Winstead', 'Hannah James', 'Josh Radnor']}
Review Text: A good series to binge on.  The characters are believable; the costumes are gorgeous and the plots keep you watching.
Review Title: Watch this series!
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/07/17
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Barrett', 'Ralph Hemecker', 'Robert Harmon', 'Alex Zakrzewski', 'John Behring', 'Alex Chapple', 'Jackeline Tejada', 'Eric Laneuville', 'Michael Pressman', 'Douglas Aarniokoski'], 'Studio': ['CBS']}
Review Text: Family oriented show who are not afraid to show their faith. But good cop show too. Nobody is perfect or a know-it-all. Not to mention Tom Selleck.  Third time around on this series for me.
Review Title: Can't miss series.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchasing history reflects a strong preference for emotionally engaging narratives, as evidenced by high ratings for well-crafted dramas and historical documentaries. They are drawn to period pieces and character-driven stories, typically enjoying those that incorporate elements of personal struggle and complex dynamics, indicating an appreciation for depth in storytelling. 

Common use cases for purchased content include seeking entertainment that offers both emotional connection and occasional escapism, often as background noise, suggesting a casual yet discerning viewer mindset. The frequent selection of English-language productions reveals a preference for accessible content, while multiple instances of high ratings (4.5+) indicate a positive response to quality storytelling and production value. 

Quality preferences lean towards character authenticity and plot intricacies, particularly in period dramas and thought-provoking documentaries. However, there is a sense of price sensitivity; the individual appears cautious about investment in content that lacks engagement, opting to remove those perceived as mediocre or non-rewatchable from their watchlist. 

Overall, the core preferences illustrate a balance between entertainment and substance, with a tendency towards elite productions, particularly in genres such as historical documentaries and well-executed serialized dramas that garner emotional investment.

target_interaction.title: Too much drama
target_interaction.text: Not as good as Season 1.  Kind of boring in parts and moves slowly.  There is a lot of drama among the characters.  I have not finished the season and am questioning whether I will.
